intro: Echinolaena ecuadoriana, commonly known as the Ecuadorian burrgrass, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and dense, spiny seed heads. The plant produces small, wind-dispersed seeds that are enclosed in bristly structures, aiding in its propagation across open habitats. It thrives in dry, rocky environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Due to its hardy nature, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
